page.title: 09CULL OF HERRING GULLS
page.content: {CULL OF HERRING GULLS} This year, following complaints to the council about flocks of herring gulls attacking children the problem was investigated and the decision was taken to carry out a cull. Apart from the danger of aggressive gulls during the nesting season, property owners complained of gulls nesting on the roofs and houses. Owners were annoyed by gulls doing a lot of damage both to property and gardens. Their droppings were a local nuisance, and when droppings fell into chimneys moss eventually grew on them blocking the chimneys. It was decided to reduce the number of herring gulls by destroying eggs. This was done last year but was not effective enough. It is hoped that this effort will succeed in reducing the number by 25%.
